addressleaf.section:
8 Octo
b
1590 M
r
Bodeleie to my L./. Takinge of
Stevenbergh
.

page.lettertext:
fol.129r
May it please yo
r
good L. The fitte
opportunitie of a messenger being offered,
but geving me no leasure, to write at any
length, I send yo
r
L. herew
t
Count
Maurice
owne letter to
e
Councel of state
,
declaring the surrendrie of
e towne of steen-
berghen: w
ch
gives a great contentm
t
to
e people of this contrey. For
e passage
by water between
Holland
and
Zeland
,
will no we in a maner be cleane out of danger:
and
e contrey eased of a great expense, in
maintening shippes of warre, for
e only
securitie of those
at passed that way.
And
thus I take my humble leave. From
e
Hage
. Oc
t
8. 1590.
Yo
r
L. most humbly bounden
Tho.Bodley
